items.title: President Trump stands ready to send U.S. Big Oil into Venezuela en masse, but the messy reality of rebuilding a ruined industry takes many years
items.description: Doubling Venezuela's weakened oil flows could cost $110 billion and take until 2030.

items.title: Trump’s strike on Venezuela gives the U.S. 30% of the world’s oil reserves on paper and a $100 billion rebuilding job in reality
items.description: “I don't think any large U.S. major company is going to want to invest without a series of guarantees,” one historian of Venezuela said.

items.title: Trump tells NBC U.S. may reimburse firms for Venezuela oil efforts
items.description: Energy experts say reviving Venezuela’s oil industry could be a decade-long process, and could cost upwards of $100 billion.

items.title: Energy stocks rip as JP Morgan estimates the U.S. could hold 30% of all the world’s oil
items.description: U.S. control of the Venezuelan energy industry could “reshape the balance of power in international energy markets,” analysts with JP Morgan wrote Mon...

items.title: Under Biden, America got 150 countries to agree a 15% global corporate tax. Under Trump, America gets an exemption
items.description: Scott Bessent called it “a historic victory in preserving U.S. sovereignty and protecting American workers and businesses from extraterritorial overre...
